monitor_button_tooltip:
Starts monitoring.
Right double-click to stop
Right triple-click to start
open_image_folder_tooltip: Opens the folder where registered images are saved
auto_scale_use_window_tooltip:
ON: Applies the optimal scale obtained from windows or searching to the template.
OFF: Disables scale correction and always attempts recognition at the original image size (1.0x).
auto_scale_desc:
Window Scale Reference:
When the recognition area is set to a window, the scaling factor from its base size is automatically calculated and applied as the scale.
Recognition accuracy decreases when scaling is active, so lower the recognition accuracy if image recognition fails.
app_setting_grayscale_desc:
Pros: Faster processing, ignores subtle color differences.
Cons: Cannot distinguish images with the same shape but different colors.
app_setting_dxcam_desc:
Pros: Strong for game rendering, fast capture with low CPU load.
Cons: May not work with some apps or PC environments.
app_setting_eco_mode_desc: After a click, monitoring switches to a low-frequency mode (once per second) to reduce CPU load if no matching image is found for 5 seconds.
app_setting_frame_skip_desc:
Pros: Higher values reduce CPU load.
Cons: Slower reaction to sudden screen changes.
app_setting_opencl_desc:
Pros: Uses the GPU to speed up image processing, reducing CPU load and improving performance, especially on high-resolution screens or when recognizing large images.
Cons: May cause slight overhead for some operations. Compatibility issues with GPU drivers may occur.

[CAUTION] If you experience instability errors like amdgpu_cs_query_fence_status failed in Linux or when used with certain games, please turn this option OFF.
app_setting_stability_desc:
Detects screen drawing or effects and holds clicks until the screen stabilizes.
A higher value means larger screen changes will still be considered "stable".
app_setting_lw_mode_desc:
Standard: Default settings (Scale: 0.5x, Skip: +5)
Performance: Higher performance than standard (Scale: 0.4x, Skip: +20)
Ultra: Attempts maximum lightness, but may not work in some environments (Scale: 0.3x, Skip: +25)

Note: Enabling Lightweight Mode disables the auto-scale feature.
item_setting_debounce_tooltip:
When the same image matches consecutively, the second click time is extended to 'Interval + Debounce time'.
This creates an opportunity for other images with a longer interval to be clicked first.
item_setting_point_click_tooltip: Sets a single point on the preview image as the click coordinates.
item_setting_range_click_tooltip: Sets a rectangular range on the preview image and clicks the center or a random position within it.
item_setting_roi_enable_tooltip:
Enabling ROI (Region of Interest) limits the search target to the specified area.
This allows for faster matching and reduced processing load compared to searching the entire screen.

„ÉªFixed: Automatically sets a 200x200 pixel area centered on the click coordinates.
„ÉªVariable: Drag on the preview to freely set the search area.
item_setting_roi_mode_fixed_tooltip: Uses a fixed 200x200 pixel area centered on the set click coordinates as the ROI.
item_setting_roi_mode_variable_tooltip: Drag on the preview to set an arbitrary search area.
item_setting_roi_button_tooltip:
Sets the image's Region of Interest (ROI).
During setting, click coordinates and range drawing become relative coordinates within the ROI.
Press again to cancel the setting.
warn_delete_no_selection: Please select the items to delete.

folder_dialog_group_image: Detailed Settings for Image Recognition Priority
folder_dialog_group_timer: Detailed Settings for Priority with Timer
folder_dialog_tooltip_image:
Image Recognition Priority Mode Details:
If at least one image in this folder is found on the screen, this folder enters priority mode.
Priority mode is released under one of the following conditions:
  • All images in this folder have been clicked once.
  • No image in this folder has been found for the duration of the 'Time to release priority mode'.
folder_dialog_tooltip_timer:
Priority with Timer Mode Details:
When the set 'Interval before activation' passes, only images in this folder are searched preferentially.
Priority mode is released when the 'Time to release priority mode' passes.
If an image in this folder is clicked, the activation timer is reset.

folder_dialog_group_cooldown: Detailed Settings for Cooldown on Hit
folder_dialog_tooltip_cooldown:
Cooldown on Hit Mode Details:
If at least one image in this folder is clicked, the entire folder will stop searching (be ignored) for the specified duration.
Use this when you want to execute one item and then temporarily ignore the group.
auto_scale_search_desc:
Automatic Multi-Scale Search:
Used when there are subtle differences between the registered image and the actual object's size (e.g., text rendering differences).
Searches from the 'Center' magnification by the 'Range (¬±)' amount, divided into 'Steps'.
* Increasing the number of steps increases the load.
folder_dialog_tooltip_sequence:
Sequence Priority Mode Details:
When the top image in this folder matches, sequence mode is activated.
The second and subsequent images are searched in order.
Searches for the 'Wait time per step' set for each image, and then forcibly moves to the next image regardless of whether a match was found.
log_sequence_started: Sequential priority mode started. Steps remaining: %s
